get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a list of asset families. Asset families are paginated.

parameters.name: search_after
parameters.description: Cursor when using the `search_after` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

href.description: URI of the current page of resources
URI of the first page of resources
URI of the next page of resources

labels.description: Asset family labels for each locale
labels.x-validation-rules: The `localeCode` is the code of an existing and activated locale

localeCode.description: Asset family label for the locale `localeCode`

product_link_rules.description: The rules that will be run after the asset creation, in order to automatically link the assets of this family to a set of products. To understand the format of this property, see here.
product_link_rules.x-validation-rules: To know more about the validation of this property, take a look at our product link rule format.

product_selections.description: The product selection to which the assets of the asset family to be automatically linked. More details here.

assign_assets_to.description: The product value in which your assets will be assigned. More details here.

406.x-details: The `Accept` header is not `application/json` but it should

examples.message: ‘xxx’ in ‘Accept‘ header is not valid. Only ‘application/json‘ is allowed.

get.summary: Get the list of attributes of a given asset family
get.description: This endpoint allows you to get the list of attributes of a given asset family.

200.description: Return the attributes of the given asset family

labels.x-validation-rules: The `localeCode` is the code of an existing and activated locale

value_per_locale.description: Whether the attribute is localizable, i.e. can have one value by locale

value_per_channel.description: Whether the attribute is scopable, i.e. can have one value by channel

is_required_for_completeness.description: Whether the attribute should be part of the record's completeness calculation

max_characters.description: Maximum number of characters allowed for the value of the attribute when the attribute type is `text`

is_textarea.description: Whether the UI should display a text area instead of a simple field when the attribute type is `text`

is_rich_text_editor.description: Whether the UI should display a rich text editor instead of a simple text area when the attribute type is `text`
is_rich_text_editor.x-validation-rules: Required when the property `is_textarea` is equal to `true`

validation_rule.description: Validation rule type used to validate the attribute value when the attribute type is `text`

validation_regexp.description: Regexp expression used to validate the attribute value when the attribute type is `text`
validation_regexp.x-validation-rules: Required when the property `validation_rule` is equal to `regexp`

allowed_extensions.description: Extensions allowed when the attribute type is `media_file`

max_file_size.description: Max file size in MB when the attribute type is `media_file`

decimals_allowed.description: Whether decimals are allowed when the attribute type is `number`

min_value.description: Minimum value allowed when the attribute type is `number`
min_value.x-validation-rules: The minimum value must be lower than the maximum value

max_value.description: Maximum value allowed when the attribute type is `number`
max_value.x-validation-rules: The maximum value must be greater than the minimum value

media_type.description: For the `media_link` attribute type, it is the type of the media behind the url, to allow its preview in the PIM. For the `media_file` attribute type, it is the type of the file.
media_type.x-warning: Only required for `media_link` and `media_file` attribute types

prefix.description: Prefix of the `media_link` attribute type. The common url root that prefixes the link to the media

suffix.description: Suffix of the `media_link` attribute type. The common url suffix for the media

401.x-details: Can be caused by a missing or expired token

406.x-details: The `Accept` header is not `application/json` but it should

examples.message: ‘xxx’ in ‘Accept‘ header is not valid. Only ‘application/json‘ is allowed.

post.summary: Create a new media file for an asset
post.description: This endpoint allows you to create a new media file and associate it to a media file attribute value of an asset.

parameters.name: Content-type
parameters.description: Equal to 'multipart/form-data', no other value allowed

file.description: The binary of the media file

201.x-details: Means that the media file creation was successful

get.summary: Get the list of the assets of a given asset family
get.description: This endpoint allows you to get a list of assets of a given asset family. Assets are paginated.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Filter assets, for more details see the Asset filters section

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Filter asset values to return scopable asset attributes for the given channel as well as the non localizable/non scopable asset attributes, for more details see the Filter asset values by channel section

parameters.name: locales
parameters.description: Filter asset values to return localizable attributes for the given locales as well as the non localizable/non scopable asset attributes, for more details see the Filter asset values by locale section

parameters.name: search_after
parameters.description: Cursor when using the `search_after` pagination method type. Should never be set manually, see Pagination section

200.description: Return the assets of the given asset family paginated

href.description: URI of the current page of resources
URI of the first page of resources
URI of the next page of resources

values.description: Asset attributes values, see the Focus on the asset values section for more details.
values.x-validation-rules: Validation rules detailed in Asset attribute values section

channel.description: Channel code of the asset attribute value

locale.description: Locale code of the asset attribute value

401.x-details: Can be caused by a missing or expired token

406.x-details: The `Accept` header is not `application/json` but it should

examples.message: ‘xxx’ in ‘Accept‘ header is not valid. Only ‘application/json‘ is allowed.

patch.description: This endpoint allows you to update and/or create several assets of one given asset family at once. Learn more about the Update behavior. Note that if the asset does not already exist for the given asset family, it creates it.

values.description: Asset attributes values, see the Focus on the asset values section for more details.
values.x-validation-rules: Validation rules detailed in Asset attribute values section

channel.description: Channel code of the asset attribute value

locale.description: Locale code of the asset attribute value

200.x-details: Returns an JSON array in which each object gives you the status of each asset creation or update

400.x-details: Can be caused by a malformed JSON request

401.x-details: Can be caused by a missing or expired token

413.x-details: There are too many resources to process (max 100) or the line of JSON is too long (max 1 000 000 characters)

examples.message: Too many resources to process, 100 is the maximum allowed.
‘xxx’ in ‘Content-type’ header is not valid.  Only ‘application/vnd.akeneo.collection+json’ is allowed.
